GOD.content: Abraham’s “Here I am” requires that he renounces family loyalties
GOD.linkedContent: Abraham’s “Here I am” requires that he renounces family loyalties

GT.content: Heidegger on gift, Heidegger discovers an etymology of khreon that links it to hand, to reaching for, also links it to logos > Derrida wonders about credit cards, coded signatures
GT.linkedContent: Heidegger on gift, Heidegger discovers an etymology of khreon that links it to hand, to reaching for, also links it to logos > Derrida wonders about credit cards, coded signatures

GT.content: also to khreon as presencing of what is present (das Anwesen des Anwesenden)
GT.linkedContent: also to khreon as presencing of what is present (das Anwesen des Anwesenden)

GT.content: true, authentic money, nature’s gift of a present
GT.linkedContent: true, authentic money, nature’s gift of a present

OOG.content: living present reduces, without negation, all alterity: “the Living Present constitutes the other as other in itself and the same as the same in the other”
OOG.linkedContent: living present reduces, without negation, all alterity: “the Living Present constitutes the other as other in itself and the same as the same in the other”

OOG.content: the Living Present > most responsible security of every phenom. reduction: “in the ultimate juridical instant (instance) is announced the most radical unity of the world”
OOG.linkedContent: the Living Present > most responsible security of every phenom. reduction: “in the ultimate juridical instant (instance) is announced the most radical unity of the world”

OOG.content: “again and again” places math in infinite task > grounded by Living Present: primordial Absolute in an indefinite protention, animated and unified by Idea (in the Kantian Sense)
OOG.linkedContent: “again and again” places math in infinite task > grounded by Living Present: primordial Absolute in an indefinite protention, animated and unified by Idea (in the Kantian Sense)

OOG.content: the Living Present: indefinite Maintenance of double enveloping (protention, retention)
OOG.linkedContent: the Living Present: indefinite Maintenance of double enveloping (protention, retention)

OOG.content: movement of primordial temporalization (protention, retention) was, as every dialectic wants, a dialectic in to nondialectical (the Living Present, universal form of all consciousness)
OOG.linkedContent: movement of primordial temporalization (protention, retention) was, as every dialectic wants, a dialectic in to nondialectical (the Living Present, universal form of all consciousness)

OOG.content: subjectivity “normed” in the Present, “fastened” to a “higher subjectivity,” higher sense investigation
OOG.linkedContent: subjectivity “normed” in the Present, “fastened” to a “higher subjectivity,” higher sense investigation

OOG.content: in going out from self to self of the Absolute of Living Present present, intentionality is the root of historicity, historicity is sense
OOG.linkedContent: in going out from self to self of the Absolute of Living Present present, intentionality is the root of historicity, historicity is sense

OOG.content: “access to Being and Being’s arrival must always already be contracted [stricture] or drawn together when phenomenology begins by claiming the right to speak (droit à parole)” > prescribing historicity for Being avoids simple misfortune of delay: phenomenology alone can open absolute subjectivity of Sense to Being-History, as auto-temporalization of Living Present
OOG.linkedContent: “access to Being and Being’s arrival must always already be contracted [stricture] or drawn together when phenomenology begins by claiming the right to speak (droit à parole)” > prescribing historicity for Being avoids simple misfortune of delay: phenomenology alone can open absolute subjectivity of Sense to Being-History, as auto-temporalization of Living Present

OOG.content: delay is thus philosophical absolute, and absolute origin in general
OOG.linkedContent: delay is thus philosophical absolute, and absolute origin in general

FL.content: the undecidable remains caught, lodged, as a ghost, an essential ghost, in every decision, every event, the ghostliness deconstructs from within all assurance of presence
FL.linkedContent: the undecidable remains caught, lodged, as a ghost, an essential ghost, in every decision, every event, the ghostliness deconstructs from within all assurance of presence

FL.content: [re: Zur Kritik der Gewalt] nomination as originary destination of name (for Benjamin), the gift or the call of presence in the name, but how is the thought of the name articulated with haunting and the logic of the specter?
FL.linkedContent: [re: Zur Kritik der Gewalt] nomination as originary destination of name (for Benjamin), the gift or the call of presence in the name, but how is the thought of the name articulated with haunting and the logic of the specter?

FL.content: when people talk about “our time,” “our present” in the future anterior, they don’t know what they are saying > it’s precisely in this nonknowledge that the eventness of the event consists, what’s naively called its presence
FL.linkedContent: when people talk about “our time,” “our present” in the future anterior, they don’t know what they are saying > it’s precisely in this nonknowledge that the eventness of the event consists, what’s naively called its presence

SPOM.content: “non-contemporaneity with itself of the living present”
SPOM.linkedContent: “non-contemporaneity with itself of the living present”

SPOM.content: what is effective/present about a ghost is its virtuality, ineffectivity
SPOM.linkedContent: what is effective/present about a ghost is its virtuality, ineffectivity

SPOM.content: “to be present” not un mot d’esprit, but le mot de l’esprit > the first verbal body
SPOM.linkedContent: “to be present” not un mot d’esprit, but le mot de l’esprit > the first verbal body

SPOM.content: those who oppose simulacrum to presence can’t think event
SPOM.linkedContent: those who oppose simulacrum to presence can’t think event

SPOM.content: Cartesian cogito, Kantian “I think,” phenomenological ego cogito: “a real presence is promised here to a Eucharistic Narcissus” > living being visited by its own apparition
SPOM.linkedContent: Cartesian cogito, Kantian “I think,” phenomenological ego cogito: “a real presence is promised here to a Eucharistic Narcissus” > living being visited by its own apparition

HERP.content: acc. Aristotle, there must be presence in act of friendship > can exhaust itself in non-address, immediate non-hailing (non-interpellation) [does Heidegger agree? see p. 176]
HERP.linkedContent: acc. Aristotle, there must be presence in act of friendship > can exhaust itself in non-address, immediate non-hailing (non-interpellation) [does Heidegger agree? see p. 176]

MPM.content: memory of present divides the instant? inscribes difference in presence of present?
MPM.linkedContent: memory of present divides the instant? inscribes difference in presence of present?

MPM.content: difference btwn simple present and presence of present is never present > arises only for memory
MPM.linkedContent: difference btwn simple present and presence of present is never present > arises only for memory

A.content: we can never say these are the conditions of inexhaustible singularity of event, must speak in negative form (w/out X no Y) [Derrida against present or presentation of “this is that”]
A.linkedContent: we can never say these are the conditions of inexhaustible singularity of event, must speak in negative form (w/out X no Y) [Derrida against present or presentation of “this is that”]

SEC.content: though representation supplements presence, the general assumption [Condillac] is that writing repairs > a continuous, homogenous modification of presence in representation
SEC.linkedContent: though representation supplements presence, the general assumption [Condillac] is that writing repairs > a continuous, homogenous modification of presence in representation

SEC.content: for Condillac, trace means “to express,” “to represent,” “to recall,” “to make present”
SEC.linkedContent: for Condillac, trace means “to express,” “to represent,” “to recall,” “to make present”

SEC.content: a written sign can break with its context (set of presences which organize moment of inscription), still be legible, can always be lifted from interlocking chain, grafted into other chains
SEC.linkedContent: a written sign can break with its context (set of presences which organize moment of inscription), still be legible, can always be lifted from interlocking chain, grafted into other chains

SEC.content: general possibility of “parasite”: 1) trap (piège), failure (échec), abyss outside/in front of language, ditch (fossé), place of external perdition, which language can avoid, sheltered by (à l’abri de) its essence or telos? 2) or is this risk, internal and positive condition of its possibility, this outside its inside?
SEC.linkedContent: general possibility of “parasite”: 1) trap (piège), failure (échec), abyss outside/in front of language, ditch (fossé), place of external perdition, which language can avoid, sheltered by (à l’abri de) its essence or telos? 2) or is this risk, internal and positive condition of its possibility, this outside its inside?

SEC.content: Austin makes us accept as ordinary a teleological and ethical determination > univocality of statement, self presence of total context, transparency of intentions, presence of meaning—absolute singular oneness of speech act
SEC.linkedContent: Austin makes us accept as ordinary a teleological and ethical determination > univocality of statement, self presence of total context, transparency of intentions, presence of meaning—absolute singular oneness of speech act

EM.content: for Heidegger, exemplary being is “phenomenological,” governed by principle of principles, i.e. presence and presence in self-presence, manifested in being we are, such proximity determines factum
EM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, exemplary being is “phenomenological,” governed by principle of principles, i.e. presence and presence in self-presence, manifested in being we are, such proximity determines factum

EM.content: if Heidegger has radically deconstructed domination of metaphysics by the present, by leading us to think presence of the present, this thinking can only be metaphorized, and can’t simply decide to escape a profound necessity, language it deconstructs
EM.linkedContent: if Heidegger has radically deconstructed domination of metaphysics by the present, by leading us to think presence of the present, this thinking can only be metaphorized, and can’t simply decide to escape a profound necessity, language it deconstructs

EM.content: [here Derrida shows limits of Heidegger’s deconstruction?] prevalence given to phenomenological metaphor (phainesthai, shining, lighting, clearing, Lichtung) opens to space of presence, presence of space, opposition near & far > thought prior to opposition space & time, opening of a spacing which belongs to neither, dislocates while producing presence of the present p. 132n (158n) Heidegger destroys privilege of present-now (Gegenwart) by way of a presence (Anwesen, Anwesenheit) which 3 modes of present (present-present, past-present, future-present) can’t exhaust > provides playing space (l’espace de jeu) on basis of the fourfold (On Time and Being), “an alternative always suspended over its ‘own proper’ abysm”: it is the text of dissemination
EM.linkedContent: [here Derrida shows limits of Heidegger’s deconstruction?] prevalence given to phenomenological metaphor (phainesthai, shining, lighting, clearing, Lichtung) opens to space of presence, presence of space, opposition near & far > thought prior to opposition space & time, opening of a spacing which belongs to neither, dislocates while producing presence of the present p. 132n (158n) Heidegger destroys privilege of present-now (Gegenwart) by way of a presence (Anwesen, Anwesenheit) which 3 modes of present (present-present, past-present, future-present) can’t exhaust > provides playing space (l’espace de jeu) on basis of the fourfold (On Time and Being), “an alternative always suspended over its ‘own proper’ abysm”: it is the text of dissemination

EM.content: Derrida on privilege of spoken language in Heidegger [I’ll study it elsewhere?] leads back to Being as presence, Anwesenheit > but, is also erased when Heidegger announces a Wesen that wouldn’t be Anwesen (see OS [?])
EM.linkedContent: Derrida on privilege of spoken language in Heidegger [I’ll study it elsewhere?] leads back to Being as presence, Anwesenheit > but, is also erased when Heidegger announces a Wesen that wouldn’t be Anwesen (see OS [?])

PP.content: text is forever imperceptible, its laws and rules [legibility?] are not “harbored in the inaccessibility of a secret,” but can never be booked (se livrent) in the present
PP.linkedContent: text is forever imperceptible, its laws and rules [legibility?] are not “harbored in the inaccessibility of a secret,” but can never be booked (se livrent) in the present

PP.content: an inscription, Delphikon gramma [Phaedrus (229d)], anything but oracle > the imperative of self-knowledge not dictated by self-presence, hermeneutics assigns intuition
PP.linkedContent: an inscription, Delphikon gramma [Phaedrus (229d)], anything but oracle > the imperative of self-knowledge not dictated by self-presence, hermeneutics assigns intuition

PP.content: for Plato, only truth as presence of the present is discriminative > discrimination become so subtle it separates nothing, the same from itself (this movement is only possible within structure of ambiguity and reversibility of pharmakon)
PP.linkedContent: for Plato, only truth as presence of the present is discriminative > discrimination become so subtle it separates nothing, the same from itself (this movement is only possible within structure of ambiguity and reversibility of pharmakon)

PP.content: if truth is presence to eidos, would it not be absolute blindness? death?
PP.linkedContent: if truth is presence to eidos, would it not be absolute blindness? death?

PP.content: “at once (à la fois):” identity is doubled as its simulacrum, phantasm, at once (identity of presence, presence of its identity, doubled as soon as it appears)
PP.linkedContent: “at once (à la fois):” identity is doubled as its simulacrum, phantasm, at once (identity of presence, presence of its identity, doubled as soon as it appears)

PP.content: differance at once condition of possibility and impossibility of truth, disappearance of any originary presence
PP.linkedContent: differance at once condition of possibility and impossibility of truth, disappearance of any originary presence

VM.content: egological life has “living present” as irreducible absolutely universal form, permits other presents in the form of memory or anticipation;
VM.linkedContent: egological life has “living present” as irreducible absolutely universal form, permits other presents in the form of memory or anticipation;

VM.content: “living present” : originally and forever violent, freeing of absolute alterity in absolute same > if other can only be respected/dissimulated by the same, then time is violence, living present originally marked by death > “presence as violence is the meaning of finitude, meaning of meaning as history”
VM.linkedContent: “living present” : originally and forever violent, freeing of absolute alterity in absolute same > if other can only be respected/dissimulated by the same, then time is violence, living present originally marked by death > “presence as violence is the meaning of finitude, meaning of meaning as history”

VM.content: present as absolute form of experience: pre-comprehending anticipation of Being as time, the ens of praes-ens > if Being has always been determined by philosophy as presence, the question of Being posed on basis of transcendental horizon of time > first tremor of philosophical security, of self-confident presence
VM.linkedContent: present as absolute form of experience: pre-comprehending anticipation of Being as time, the ens of praes-ens > if Being has always been determined by philosophy as presence, the question of Being posed on basis of transcendental horizon of time > first tremor of philosophical security, of self-confident presence

OH.content: every time Europe, politics, responsibility, decision is reduced to what they must exceed (order of the present, of presentation [knowledge, certainty, judgment in the form “this is that”]), we have the very presentable face of good conscience
OH.linkedContent: every time Europe, politics, responsibility, decision is reduced to what they must exceed (order of the present, of presentation [knowledge, certainty, judgment in the form “this is that”]), we have the very presentable face of good conscience

VP.content: the ideality of ideality, living-present, self-presence of transcendental life; presence always the form, to infinity, through which an infinite diversity of contents will be produced > concrete ideality of “living present” justifies opposition btwn form and content ultimately and radically
VP.linkedContent: the ideality of ideality, living-present, self-presence of transcendental life; presence always the form, to infinity, through which an infinite diversity of contents will be produced > concrete ideality of “living present” justifies opposition btwn form and content ultimately and radically

VP.content: the security of presence is founded on the non-empirical, the sign, the non-foundation, exposing this removes this security
VP.linkedContent: the security of presence is founded on the non-empirical, the sign, the non-foundation, exposing this removes this security

VP.content: Husserl determines logos on basis of logic, giving logicity the normalcy of logos’ telos, the telos of being as presence; this requires distinction btwn pure logic or “pure logical grammar” and pure grammar [logic before language]
VP.linkedContent: Husserl determines logos on basis of logic, giving logicity the normalcy of logos’ telos, the telos of being as presence; this requires distinction btwn pure logic or “pure logical grammar” and pure grammar [logic before language]

VP.content: last court of appeal for phenomenology is “consciousness,” possibility of the self-presence of the present in the living present
VP.linkedContent: last court of appeal for phenomenology is “consciousness,” possibility of the self-presence of the present in the living present

VP.content: “ideality is the salvation or mastery of presence in repetition” (this is why Husserl claims intuition is not reell), not a presence of anything that exists in the world, in correlation w/ ideal acts of repetition [idealization secured by a certain relation of “existent” to his death]
VP.linkedContent: “ideality is the salvation or mastery of presence in repetition” (this is why Husserl claims intuition is not reell), not a presence of anything that exists in the world, in correlation w/ ideal acts of repetition [idealization secured by a certain relation of “existent” to his death]

VP.content: non-self-presence of living present: relation to others, self-relation of temporalization
VP.linkedContent: non-self-presence of living present: relation to others, self-relation of temporalization

VP.content: no need for communication in the psychical act, no need to indicate psychical acts, it is psyche; Husserl: “acts are lived by us in the very instant.”
VP.linkedContent: no need for communication in the psychical act, no need to indicate psychical acts, it is psyche; Husserl: “acts are lived by us in the very instant.”

VP.content: presence as universal form of all existence, transgression of all empirical, and first of all mine, but even beyond my death, this present still is, must be to be universal; if the possibility of the sign is this relation to death: erasure of sign is dissimulation of this relation to death
VP.linkedContent: presence as universal form of all existence, transgression of all empirical, and first of all mine, but even beyond my death, this present still is, must be to be universal; if the possibility of the sign is this relation to death: erasure of sign is dissimulation of this relation to death

VP.content: Husserl: presence lived experientially im selben Augenblick; Derrida: present as self-presence is as indivisible as a blink of an eye
VP.linkedContent: Husserl: presence lived experientially im selben Augenblick; Derrida: present as self-presence is as indivisible as a blink of an eye

VP.content: “sharp point of the instant”: identity of lived-experience present to itself
VP.linkedContent: “sharp point of the instant”: identity of lived-experience present to itself

VP.content: via Husserl, Greek metaphysics of presence becomes “modern” metaphysics of presence as self-consciousness, metaphysics of idea as representation (Vorstellung)
VP.linkedContent: via Husserl, Greek metaphysics of presence becomes “modern” metaphysics of presence as self-consciousness, metaphysics of idea as representation (Vorstellung)

VP.content: for Husserl, primary memory and primary anticipation are non-presences, non-perceptions, required for presence of perceived present [retentional memory is perception?]
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, primary memory and primary anticipation are non-presences, non-perceptions, required for presence of perceived present [retentional memory is perception?]

VP.content: for Husserl, non-presence does not dissimulate, surprise, presence, it allows the ever reborn virginity of presence
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, non-presence does not dissimulate, surprise, presence, it allows the ever reborn virginity of presence

VP.content: ideality of the form of presence can be repeated to infinity as return of the same, but retained in a finite movement
VP.linkedContent: ideality of the form of presence can be repeated to infinity as return of the same, but retained in a finite movement

VP.content: presence to itself of animating act, this intimacy of life to itself is why we say speech is alive, we hear our voice, thus the deaf are dumb
VP.linkedContent: presence to itself of animating act, this intimacy of life to itself is why we say speech is alive, we hear our voice, thus the deaf are dumb

VP.content: the more the signifier is ideal, more it augments potency of repetition of presence, the more it protects, preserves, reserves and capitalizes on sense
VP.linkedContent: the more the signifier is ideal, more it augments potency of repetition of presence, the more it protects, preserves, reserves and capitalizes on sense

VP.content: presence is the matrix of sense, ideality, objectivity, truth, intuition, perception and expression > because these are all determined as ideality they are all deferred to infinity
VP.linkedContent: presence is the matrix of sense, ideality, objectivity, truth, intuition, perception and expression > because these are all determined as ideality they are all deferred to infinity

FSW.content: acc. Heidegger, Hegel and Descartes conceive self-presence w/in opposition of consciousness to unconsciousness
FSW.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, Hegel and Descartes conceive self-presence w/in opposition of consciousness to unconsciousness

FSW.content: Nachtrag (postscript, appendix, codicil) > present is only a call for a footnote
FSW.linkedContent: Nachtrag (postscript, appendix, codicil) > present is only a call for a footnote

FSW.content: Freud’s theme that there is no purity to living present, formidable for metaphysics, found in a conceptual scheme unequal to the thing itself
FSW.linkedContent: Freud’s theme that there is no purity to living present, formidable for metaphysics, found in a conceptual scheme unequal to the thing itself

FSW.content: unerasable trace, not a trace, full-presence, son of God, sign of parousia, not a seed, not a mortal germ
FSW.linkedContent: unerasable trace, not a trace, full-presence, son of God, sign of parousia, not a seed, not a mortal germ

WM.content: one true metaphor (no more true metaphor): but assured legibility of the proper [presence disappearing in its own radiance, hidden source of light]
WM.linkedContent: one true metaphor (no more true metaphor): but assured legibility of the proper [presence disappearing in its own radiance, hidden source of light]

OS.content: chain of interdependent concepts (ousia, parousia, Anwesenheit, Gegenwart, gegenwärtigen, Vorhandenheit) deposited only at beginning/end of Sein un Zeit > who better than Heidegger to think of problem of translation re: these terms
OS.linkedContent: chain of interdependent concepts (ousia, parousia, Anwesenheit, Gegenwart, gegenwärtigen, Vorhandenheit) deposited only at beginning/end of Sein un Zeit > who better than Heidegger to think of problem of translation re: these terms

OS.content: Heidegger: Hegel’s jetzt as boundary (Grenze), ‘absolute this (das ‘absolute Dieses’); Aristotle’s nun as stigmē, tode ti > both circular (Kreislauf, sphaira)
OS.linkedContent: Heidegger: Hegel’s jetzt as boundary (Grenze), ‘absolute this (das ‘absolute Dieses’); Aristotle’s nun as stigmē, tode ti > both circular (Kreislauf, sphaira)

OS.content: Heidegger designates milieu of self-evidence, outside which thought suffocates > has not entire philosophy been authorized on “extraordinary right” of present? for Heidegger, it’s not a question of thinking otherwise, it’s thinking that which could not have been, nor thought, otherwise
OS.linkedContent: Heidegger designates milieu of self-evidence, outside which thought suffocates > has not entire philosophy been authorized on “extraordinary right” of present? for Heidegger, it’s not a question of thinking otherwise, it’s thinking that which could not have been, nor thought, otherwise

OS.content: acc. Hegel, think present as eternity, eternity as another name of the presence of the present (eternal, Idea, Spirit, True, neither inside nor outside time)
OS.linkedContent: acc. Hegel, think present as eternity, eternity as another name of the presence of the present (eternal, Idea, Spirit, True, neither inside nor outside time)

OS.content: Aristotle repeats aporia of Zeno’s argument re: time, says it clarifies nothing, but does not deconstruct it > time’s nonbeing pre-comprehended as nonpresence in relation to determination of being as present
OS.linkedContent: Aristotle repeats aporia of Zeno’s argument re: time, says it clarifies nothing, but does not deconstruct it > time’s nonbeing pre-comprehended as nonpresence in relation to determination of being as present

OS.content: for Hegel, time erases time, Tilgen (to erase) is also an Aufhebung: given that time is pure exterior self, parousia is end of time
OS.linkedContent: for Hegel, time erases time, Tilgen (to erase) is also an Aufhebung: given that time is pure exterior self, parousia is end of time

OS.content: acc. Aristotle, being in act, energy, is not time but eternal presence: eternal beings (ta aei onta) are not in time
OS.linkedContent: acc. Aristotle, being in act, energy, is not time but eternal presence: eternal beings (ta aei onta) are not in time

OS.content: almost impossible to distinguish Heidegger’s Anwesenheit from Gegenwärtigkeit: sometimes it is a more original presence, other times it questions Greco-Western philosophical closure; perhaps we need to make thought tremble w/ a Wesen not yet Anwesen
OS.linkedContent: almost impossible to distinguish Heidegger’s Anwesenheit from Gegenwärtigkeit: sometimes it is a more original presence, other times it questions Greco-Western philosophical closure; perhaps we need to make thought tremble w/ a Wesen not yet Anwesen

OS.content: presence, instead of being what sign signifies, is the trace of the trace (trace of the erasure of the trace)—Heidegger: distinction Being/beings left its trace as presence
OS.linkedContent: presence, instead of being what sign signifies, is the trace of the trace (trace of the erasure of the trace)—Heidegger: distinction Being/beings left its trace as presence

POS.content: what defers presence (its trace, its sign, its representation) is basis of its announcement or desire
POS.linkedContent: what defers presence (its trace, its sign, its representation) is basis of its announcement or desire

SP.content: [it is impossible, and the English translation, I believe, fails to convey this, to tell whether the spur protects against presence or the threat to presence]
SP.linkedContent: [it is impossible, and the English translation, I believe, fails to convey this, to tell whether the spur protects against presence or the threat to presence]

PS.content: self-presence, Artaud’s “<small>WE KNOW IT WAS WE WHO WERE SPEAKING</small>” > magic identification
PS.linkedContent: self-presence, Artaud’s “WE KNOW IT WAS WE WHO WERE SPEAKING” > magic identification

PS.content: madness as much inalienation [presence?] as alienation
fatal complicity Artaud reveals: all destructive discourses must inhabit structures they demolish, must shelter indestructible desire for full presence, nondifference: à la fois vie et mort
PS.linkedContent: fatal complicity Artaud reveals: all destructive discourses must inhabit structures they demolish, must shelter indestructible desire for full presence, nondifference: à la fois vie et mort

PS.content: not critiquing Artaud from standpoint of metaphysics, Derrida reveals complicity: Artaud must enclose himself in closure of presence to denounce naive implications w/in difference
PS.linkedContent: not critiquing Artaud from standpoint of metaphysics, Derrida reveals complicity: Artaud must enclose himself in closure of presence to denounce naive implications w/in difference

PS.content: self-presence, unity, self-identity, proper: most profound and permanent ambition of Western metaphysics [?]
PS.linkedContent: self-presence, unity, self-identity, proper: most profound and permanent ambition of Western metaphysics [?]

DIF.content: differance constitutes present in interval, constitutes present by dividing it > everything thus thought on basis of the present, in our metaphysical language, would also be divided (subject, substance, being, etc.)
DIF.linkedContent: differance constitutes present in interval, constitutes present by dividing it > everything thus thought on basis of the present, in our metaphysical language, would also be divided (subject, substance, being, etc.)

DIF.content: privilege granted to consciousness, to the “living present”: power to synthesize traces, to constantly reassemble them
DIF.linkedContent: privilege granted to consciousness, to the “living present”: power to synthesize traces, to constantly reassemble them

DIF.content: before Heidegger purposely and radically questioned presence, Freud & Nietzsche did so, and, remarkably, they did so via motif of differance [remarkable :)]
DIF.linkedContent: before Heidegger purposely and radically questioned presence, Freud & Nietzsche did so, and, remarkably, they did so via motif of differance [remarkable :)]

DIF.content: Heidegger: when the essence of presencing unnoticeably becomes something present, the distinction btwn presencing and what is present (Anwesen und Anwesendem) is forgotten
DIF.linkedContent: Heidegger: when the essence of presencing unnoticeably becomes something present, the distinction btwn presencing and what is present (Anwesen und Anwesendem) is forgotten

DIF.content: because trace is a simulacrum of presence, erasure belongs to structure of the trace, it has no site > erasures on both sides of trace
DIF.linkedContent: because trace is a simulacrum of presence, erasure belongs to structure of the trace, it has no site > erasures on both sides of trace

DIF.content: inversion of metaphysical concepts: the present becomes trace of trace, sign of sign, mark of erasure > present is a trace & a trace of erasure of trace
DIF.linkedContent: inversion of metaphysical concepts: the present becomes trace of trace, sign of sign, mark of erasure > present is a trace & a trace of erasure of trace

O.content: modes of presence: meaning, essence, objective or subjective existence, form (i.e. appearance, content, substance), sensible/intelligible presence
O.linkedContent: modes of presence: meaning, essence, objective or subjective existence, form (i.e. appearance, content, substance), sensible/intelligible presence

DPi.content: “my life” passes by way of the heart of the other, can only prefer living to dead, living present, where it “receives its life from the heart of the other” > “my life” depends on (tient au) the heart of the other
DPi.linkedContent: “my life” passes by way of the heart of the other, can only prefer living to dead, living present, where it “receives its life from the heart of the other” > “my life” depends on (tient au) the heart of the other

Gii.content: hand speaks by way of “necessity,” chreon, usage, Brauch [?] > if the chreōn allows one to think the present in its presence, if der Brauch is “the gathering”—then, before all technology, surgery, le main n’y est pas pour rien
Gii.linkedContent: hand speaks by way of “necessity,” chreon, usage, Brauch [?] > if the chreōn allows one to think the present in its presence, if der Brauch is “the gathering”—then, before all technology, surgery, le main n’y est pas pour rien

TR.content: re: oeuvre as trace of its ambiguity, as if quasi-machine were already operating even before being produced in the world, in the vivid experience of living present
TR.linkedContent: re: oeuvre as trace of its ambiguity, as if quasi-machine were already operating even before being produced in the world, in the vivid experience of living present

D.content: pure present: la plénitude inentamée, la continuité vierge de la non-coupure (not yet having been written, à la veille du jeu)
D.linkedContent: pure present: la plénitude inentamée, la continuité vierge de la non-coupure (not yet having been written, à la veille du jeu)

D.content: present can only present itself by relating back to itself [folding back on itself], (com)plying with itself (en se pliant à soi) dans l’angle, along la brisure: a “crack (faille)” created by a joint, hinge
D.linkedContent: present can only present itself by relating back to itself [folding back on itself], (com)plying with itself (en se pliant à soi) dans l’angle, along la brisure: a “crack (faille)” created by a joint, hinge

D.content: possibility (potency) of present is its own limit, inner fold, impossibility—its impotence (btwn presence/castration) > same goes for “history,” “form”: language of metaphysics
D.linkedContent: possibility (potency) of present is its own limit, inner fold, impossibility—its impotence (btwn presence/castration) > same goes for “history,” “form”: language of metaphysics

D.content: “present” only marked in citation, storytelling, fiction
life & presence as privileged examples [of folding back onto their own limit, folding back in their very triggering] > inscribes difference in heart of life
D.linkedContent: life & presence as privileged examples [of folding back onto their own limit, folding back in their very triggering] > inscribes difference in heart of life

D.content: nothing says present better, it seems, than il y a; but what is present is a scission, il y a cette coupure, what is present & at work is a “recoil (recul),” possibility of its triggering
D.linkedContent: nothing says present better, it seems, than il y a; but what is present is a scission, il y a cette coupure, what is present & at work is a “recoil (recul),” possibility of its triggering

D.content: opening of presence, “dead surface,” 4th surface, plunged by its “history” into limitless time that is neither “present” nor a “history”
D.linkedContent: opening of presence, “dead surface,” 4th surface, plunged by its “history” into limitless time that is neither “present” nor a “history”

D.content: presence as product, tombe déjà comme un effet, sous le coup (under the sway) d’une structure machinée qui ne se livre (gives itself away) pas au présent
D.linkedContent: presence as product, tombe déjà comme un effet, sous le coup (under the sway) d’une structure machinée qui ne se livre (gives itself away) pas au présent

D.content: the opening, as presence, is not noticed as opening—we’re fascinated, glued to what presents itself: we’re unable to see presence as such, visibility of visible > never present themselves
D.linkedContent: the opening, as presence, is not noticed as opening—we’re fascinated, glued to what presents itself: we’re unable to see presence as such, visibility of visible > never present themselves

D.content: once ether (presence of present) has been called to mind: plupresent not merely presence but deformation irreducible to any form (presence, first matter in the last instance)
D.linkedContent: once ether (presence of present) has been called to mind: plupresent not merely presence but deformation irreducible to any form (presence, first matter in the last instance)

D.content: contraction into a dot (point), to where everything is present but nothing exists, pleroma, Orphic explanation [?], “drama of God,” zimzum, God going out of himself takes place [can find this in Hegel] > repetition of absolute present or undifferentiated origin
D.linkedContent: contraction into a dot (point), to where everything is present but nothing exists, pleroma, Orphic explanation [?], “drama of God,” zimzum, God going out of himself takes place [can find this in Hegel] > repetition of absolute present or undifferentiated origin

LI.content: [from SEC] structural unconsciousness, absence of intending actual utterance, prohibits any saturation of context (total presence)
LI.linkedContent: [from SEC] structural unconsciousness, absence of intending actual utterance, prohibits any saturation of context (total presence)

LI.content: “self-presence” as desire/need is not simply a linguistic superstition Derrida keeps alive to win an argument, it is indestructible, “immortal”—also death, mortifère (death bearing) > is not “pure realization of self presence” also death?
LI.linkedContent: “self-presence” as desire/need is not simply a linguistic superstition Derrida keeps alive to win an argument, it is indestructible, “immortal”—also death, mortifère (death bearing) > is not “pure realization of self presence” also death?

LI.content: repeatability of same ensures that full presence of a singularity, in being repeated, references something else, thus rending the full presence it announces
LI.linkedContent: repeatability of same ensures that full presence of a singularity, in being repeated, references something else, thus rending the full presence it announces

LI.content: this something else is why iteration is different from simple repetition
LI.linkedContent: this something else is why iteration is different from simple repetition

TN.content: for Husserl, fingers that touch (not signal, not show) deem contact the experience of presence, which is full, immediate, direct (Nancy’s syncope interrupts)
TN.linkedContent: for Husserl, fingers that touch (not signal, not show) deem contact the experience of presence, which is full, immediate, direct (Nancy’s syncope interrupts)

TN.content: Heidegger: thesis that all cognition aims at intuition has temporal meaning that all cognition aims at making present
TN.linkedContent: Heidegger: thesis that all cognition aims at intuition has temporal meaning that all cognition aims at making present

OG.content: privilege of phonè necessary moment of economy (of “life,” of “history,” of “être comme rapport à soi”), not historical contingency: not a choice that could have been avoided
OG.linkedContent: privilege of phonè necessary moment of economy (of “life,” of “history,” of “être comme rapport à soi”), not historical contingency: not a choice that could have been avoided

OG.content: writing as secondary, as technique: a translator of a full speech present to itself, its signified, its other [w/in system that privileges phonè]
OG.linkedContent: writing as secondary, as technique: a translator of a full speech present to itself, its signified, its other [w/in system that privileges phonè]

OG.content: Hegel privileges sound (speech, voice), because it is a hearing of an interior vibration
OG.linkedContent: Hegel privileges sound (speech, voice), because it is a hearing of an interior vibration

OG.content: voice, phonè, s’entendre-parler, s’affecte lui-même (hearing-oneself-speak, affecting oneself), ideality

phonocentrism se confond (merges) w/ onto-theology, produces these subdeterminations of presence: sight as eidos, substance/essence/existence (ousia), temporal presence as point (stigmè) of now (nun), consciousness, cogito, subjectivity, co-presence of other & self…
OG.linkedContent: phonocentrism se confond (merges) w/ onto-theology, produces these subdeterminations of presence: sight as eidos, substance/essence/existence (ousia), temporal presence as point (stigmè) of now (nun), consciousness, cogito, subjectivity, co-presence of other & self…

OG.content: Rousseau’s sensible cogito as another model of presence (self-presence), carries in itself inscription of divine law
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau’s sensible cogito as another model of presence (self-presence), carries in itself inscription of divine law

OG.content: Rousseau: figurative language initiates and proper meaning is discovered last > eschatology of proper (self-presence, self-proximity, own-ness)
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau: figurative language initiates and proper meaning is discovered last > eschatology of proper (self-presence, self-proximity, own-ness)

OG.content: silence as much a myth of full presence [as full speech]
OG.linkedContent: silence as much a myth of full presence [as full speech]

OG.content: restitution of presence by language: symbolic/immediate, se passe de passer par le monde: touching is touched, jouissance not deferred: auto-affection se donne pour autarcie pure, it does not wait (n’attend pas) > but, auto-affection pure speculation, present delivered is chimera, the no longer deferred is absolutely deferred: acc. Rousseau, sign/image/representation sont des illusions qui donnent le change (sidetrack us) [differance w/out delay]
OG.linkedContent: restitution of presence by language: symbolic/immediate, se passe de passer par le monde: touching is touched, jouissance not deferred: auto-affection se donne pour autarcie pure, it does not wait (n’attend pas) > but, auto-affection pure speculation, present delivered is chimera, the no longer deferred is absolutely deferred: acc. Rousseau, sign/image/representation sont des illusions qui donnent le change (sidetrack us) [differance w/out delay]

OG.content: privation of presence is condition of experience, that is, of presence
OG.linkedContent: privation of presence is condition of experience, that is, of presence

OG.content: MOP in Rousseau appears wherever fatality of supplement seems to limit it, he is more interested in presence of the present, essence as presence, as life, as self-presence, energeai, as re-birth (permits all repetitions/returns of origin)—no memory, no anticipation, no souvenir, no distinction, point d’eau, an unimaginable pleasure, the sleeping imagination [Rousseau’s beautiful depiction in Reveries…]
OG.linkedContent: MOP in Rousseau appears wherever fatality of supplement seems to limit it, he is more interested in presence of the present, essence as presence, as life, as self-presence, energeai, as re-birth (permits all repetitions/returns of origin)—no memory, no anticipation, no souvenir, no distinction, point d’eau, an unimaginable pleasure, the sleeping imagination [Rousseau’s beautiful depiction in Reveries…]

OG.content: for Derrida, there’s an interior doubling of presence, a constitution/frustration of jouissance, a call & trace that Rousseau tries to elude
OG.linkedContent: for Derrida, there’s an interior doubling of presence, a constitution/frustration of jouissance, a call & trace that Rousseau tries to elude

FV.content: [phonematic limitation of letter, phonē spared divisibility] voice: spontaneous self-presence one can retain (garder) w/out paper, w/out envelope, always available (disponible) > Lacan’s not attentive to writing w/in the voice, before the letter
FV.linkedContent: [phonematic limitation of letter, phonē spared divisibility] voice: spontaneous self-presence one can retain (garder) w/out paper, w/out envelope, always available (disponible) > Lacan’s not attentive to writing w/in the voice, before the letter

FV.content: sheltered (à l’abri) from disseminating threat/power in OG, agency of Lacan’s letter is the relève of writing in system of speech
FV.linkedContent: sheltered (à l’abri) from disseminating threat/power in OG, agency of Lacan’s letter is the relève of writing in system of speech

FV.content: for Lacan, analyst links truth to power of speech: power of communication as a contract btwn 2 present things
FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, analyst links truth to power of speech: power of communication as a contract btwn 2 present things
